item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m an environmental scientist currently working at the University Landau, Germany. Follow me here to keep you updated about my work: GitHub Google Scholar Linkedin ORCID ResearchGate Stackoverflow Twitter

item.title: Research
item.description: There will be a detailed list of my research here soon. For now I ask you to simply follow me on ResearchGate if you are interested to learn more about my work.

item.title: Software
item.description: I’m (co)-developing these R packages: standartox webchem dbreport For more of my software dwellings, follow me on GitHub.

item.title: Standartox
item.description: An increasing number of chemicals such as pharmaceuticals, pesticides and synthetic hormones are in daily use all over the world. In the environment, chemicals can adversely affect populations and communities and in turn related ecosystem functions. To evaluate the risks from chemicals for ecosystems, data on their toxicity, which are typically produced in standardized ecotoxicological laboratory tests, is required. However, this kind of data is not always easy to retrieve in adequate formats.
